text.content:
Play at the beginning of your turn while you're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}.

As you wander the limbo between life and death, you're tempted by a trickster with a true heroic recovery. Your recovery check uses the following results instead.

Critical Success You regain a number of Hit Points equal to @Damage[(2*@actor.level)[healing]]{twice your level}, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for this turn, and can take your actions immediately. The extra action must be used for a basic move action, or Interact to pick up or draw an item.

Success As critical success, but the Hit Points you regain are equal to @Damage[(@actor.level)[healing]]{your level}.

Failure You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Critical Failure You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}.

Play when you succeed a saving throw that an ally just failed.

You daydream what you would do in your ally's predicament, only to realize that was no dream at all! You swap your natural result on the d20 with your ally's, potentially changing both of your results.

Play when you critically hit an enemy or apply an enemy's weakness.

You give your ally an opportunity to follow up your assault! Choose an ally, and their initiative position is moved to directly after yours. Your turn then ends, and the chosen ally gains a circumstance bonus equal to 1 + the number of actions you had left to one attack roll or skill check they attempt against the triggering enemy.

The chosen ally chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling, and the bonus is lost if not used by the end of their turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.ouNWLIg54qdlsaeZ]{Effect: Baton Pass}

Play when you critically hit an enemy or apply an enemy's weakness.

The enemy reels from the impact, giving you a window to act. You gain an additional action that can be used to used to Strike, use a move action, or an Interact action.

Play when a conscious ally becomes inflicted with a harmful condition.

You Stride towards the triggering ally. If you end that movement action adjacent to them, attempt to counteract the triggering condition using an unarmed attack roll, or a skill check at the GM's discretion, such as Diplomacy to rally them up, or Religion to pray to your deity. Your counteract rank for this check is half your level rounded up.

Special You can use this card while Burrowing, Climbing, Flying, or Swimming if you have the corresponding movement type.

Play during your turn while you're able to use manipulate actions.

By planning ahead, you're able to have the right item at the right time. You Interact to draw a consumable item from your inventory, or from a willing ally's inventory as though it were on your own, in which case it must be an item you would've been able to carry unencumbered.

Play when you roll damage as a result of a critical success of yours, or of an enemies' critical failure.

You push yourself to inflict even more punishment onto your foe, at the expense of your own safety. You can roll damage again and use the higher of the two results. If you use the new roll, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round as a result of this reckless maneuver.

Play when an enemy is about to take their turn directly before yours.

With a sudden rush of energy, you cut ahead of your foe. You take your turn before the triggering enemy, moving your initiative position accordingly. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} at the end of your turn from this overexertion.

Play when the trigger for one of your reactions is met.

You quickly seize an opportunity to intervene. You can use the triggering reaction as a free action instead. As normal, you can use only action in response to a given trigger.

Play at any time, as long you're able to manipulate and you haven't played this card since the last time you were able to purchase goods.

You can produce an item as a 2-action activity to remove your backpack and draw the item as though you had the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.bh2jHyyYrkLMsIdX]{Prescient Planner} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.lHFz4MmebvPqTb0A]{Prescient Consumable} feats, with their normal cost and restrictions.

Special If you already have Prescient Planner, you can play this card even if you have used the feat since you last were able to purchase goods.

Play during your turn while you have at least one spell slot left.

You reshape the energy harnessed for your spell at the last second. For the next spell you Cast this turn using a spell slot, select a spell of the same tradition that you have access to—usually common spells—, and of the same rank or lower. You Cast that Spell instead.

After Casting the Spell, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the end of your next turn, as your brain is scrambled by a strange magical feedback.

Play at the start of your turn.

You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.m0f2B7G9eaaTmhFL]{Devise a Stratagem}. You can't use Intelligence instead of your usual modifier when substituting the result of your attack roll, and you can only use an attack stratagem.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.4xFVJqqB3aPpnTQp]{Effect: Advanced Strategy}

Special If you already have Devise a Stratagem, you can play this card to reroll the result of your d20 when using that ability, ignoring the usual restriction from the fortune trait. You must keep the new result.

Play during your turn.

You attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through} a creature of your size or larger. If you critically succeed, that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, as you swiftly sweep them off the ground with your slide.

Play when an encounter starts while you were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kV3XM0YJeS2KCSOb]{Scouting}.

With a quick command, you and your party get into a planned formation. You and all your allies gain their reaction, even if they normally wouldn't due to not having acted yet, and can choose to use that reaction immediately to use a basic move action or Interact to draw an item.

Play when an encounter starts while you were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EwgTZBWsc8qKaViP]{Investigating}.

You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}. Regardless of your result, the GM gives you one piece of information they deem instrumental to succeed in this encounter, in addition to answering your question as normal. You don't recall incorrect information from this attempt.

Play when an enemy critically succeeds a saving throw, or an attack roll.

Your foe's overconfidence allows you to exploit an opening. The enemy must reroll the triggering check and use the new result. If the result is a critical failure, it becomes a failure instead.

Play when an enemy Casts a Spell, you have a reaction, and at least one spell slot available.

You spend a spell slot and as a reaction you attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.E4Q7EiSG18sIvFwg]{Counteract} the triggering spell, using the rank of your spent spell slot as your counteract rank. This effect has the trait corresponding to the tradition of the spell slot used.

Special If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.EpBG4CFMNSZQx7vI]{Counterspell} feat, your counteract rank for this effect counts as one higher.

Play at the start of your turn.

Be it the guidance of a deity, a strong gut feeling, or a vision from beyond, you gain a glimpse into the near future. You gain the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} in relation to a particular course of action up to 1 minute into the future. The GM doesn't roll the usual flat check, as this glimpse is close enough to the present.

Play when you roll a natural 1 on any check during an encounter.

You willingly accept an otherworldly curse offered by an agent of chaos witnessing your battle. The triggering result becomes a natural 20 instead. However, the next natural 20 you roll in an encounter becomes a natural 1, which you must keep.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.IAqtfUOSpLVDZpMC]{Effect: Curse of Temporal Discounting}

Play at the start of your turn.

You close your eyes and focus on your other senses. For 1 round, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}, but you gain your choice of echolocation, tremorsense or wavesense, as a precise sense with a range of 60 feet.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.hjPthRPNiLM49yc2]{Effect: Instinctual Senses}

Play when you use a spell that has an area of effect.

You spread your energy over a wider region. You can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.FoWO4RnHRwfEIC7Q]{Widen Spell} spellshape with its usual action cost.

Special If you already have Widen Spell you can instead play this card to use it as a free action.

Play when you use a spell with a range.

You stretch your energy to reach beyond its usual horizon. You can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BWomK7EVY0WXxWgh]{Reach Spell} spellshape with its usual action cost.

Special If you already have Reach Spell you can instead play this card to use it as a free action.

Play at the start of your turn.

Until the end of your next turn, you can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while you're conscious. Additionally, your movement or manipulate actions do not trigger reactions.

Play when you Cast a Spell with a saving throw and a specific number of targets on your turn.

You dangerously split your spell's energy. You can increase the number of actions required to Cast the Spell by one. If you do, you add one additional target to it. If the additional target rolls a critical failure, it becomes a failure instead. This is a spellshape effect.

Play when you would roll a Diplomacy check.

You automatically receive a result of 20 + your Diplomacy modifier on your check instead of rolling. Unlike a natural 20, this does not increase your degree of success unless the result exceeds the DC by 10 or more.

Play at the start of your first turn of an encounter where you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{Avoided Notice}.

You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of your turn. You can use the extra action only to Hide, Sneak, or Take Cover.

Play when an ally is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by an enemy, and you are within reach of both.

Make a Strike against the triggering enemy. On a hit, your ally loses the condition as if they successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escaped}. For the purposes of this effect, an ally that has been @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]{Swallowed Whole} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.zU3Ovaet4xQ5Gmvy]{Engulfed} is within reach.

Play when an ally is targeted with an enemy's Strike, spell, or other ability for which you would be a valid target.

You use a pointed insult, feign an opening, or otherwise make yourself an easy target. You become the target instead of your ally.

Play when you hit, but not critically hit, an enemy with a Strike.

You benefit from your weapon or unarmed attack's critical specialization effect, as well its additional effect from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qUnDHEXteUQGE8yp]{Grievous} rune.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.mcb5Rie1D4QG3LGk]{Effect: Weapon Specialist}

Play during exploration.

Choose yourself or an ally at least trained in Stealth for you and your other allies to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tfa4Sh7wcxCEqL29]{Follow the Expert} as though they had the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.pekKtubQTkG9m1xK]{Quiet Allies} feat. For the purposes of this activity, the subject of Follow the Expert becomes an expert in Stealth if they weren't already.

Special If the chosen ally already has the Quiet Allies feat, they can use their own modifier for the single Stealth check instead of using the lowest modifier. As usual for Quiet Allies, this doesn't apply to initiative rolls.

Play when you are adjacent to an ally of your size or smaller, and you have at least one hand free.

You simply must toss them. You pick up that ally and make an Athletics check. You toss them to an unoccupied space you can see that is within the result of your check in feet, rounded down to the nearest 5 foot increment.

Special If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.V9kShXu84NlORfcg]{Friendly Toss} or another similar feat, you can use that ability instead (at no action cost, as normal for Hero Point Deck effects).

Play when an ally would be reduced to 0 Hit Points by an effect targeted at them.

Time slows down for you as you see your ally in mortal danger. You Stride toward the triggering ally. If you are adjacent to them at the end of this movement, you receive all the damage from the triggering effect instead. This damage can't be reduced in any way.

Special You can Fly, Swim or Climb instead if you have the corresponding speed.

Play when an ally is about to roll a check that can be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aided}.

You can use the Aid reaction even if you haven't prepared to help. You must still fulfill the other requirements to Aid, such as determining how you are helping and being in a position to do so.

Special You can play this card if you were already prepared to Aid to increase the degree of success of your Aid check instead.

Play at the start of your turn.

You suddenly hasten your movements. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for this turn and can use the extra action to Interact, Strike, or to take a basic move action. At the end of your turn, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Slowed 1} for 1 round, as you are forced to recuperate from this rush.

Play during your turn.

You employ an obscure thaumaturgic symbol on your weapon or across your arm, invoking the ability to potentially exploit a weakness. Until the end of your next turn, your Strikes and spells deals 1 additional damage of an energy damage type of your choice. If you worship a deity, they can instead gain a trait allowed by its divine sanctification.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.CFiEvZUKBEwDr3zV]{Effect: Symbolic Rites}

Play when a foe succeeds on an attack roll or skill check.

Your enemy suddenly struck by misfortune. The triggering enemy rerolls their check and keeps the lower result.

Play at the start of your turn.

You challenge your ally to attack the same enemy, and your competitive spirit elevates them! The next Strike you make this turn counts as the preparations to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} your ally with their next attack against the same target, using the result of your Strike as the check to Aid instead of rolling.

Play when you and at least one ally roll a saving throw against the same damaging effect.

You share your companions' pain, reinforcing their tenacity. Reduce the degree of success of your saving throw. For each step your result was reduced by, choose an ally's result and improve it by one degree of success. A single ally can improve their degree of success multiple times in this way.

Play at the start of your turn.

You commit to a high-reward, but possibly high-risk plan. You can use 3 actions to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.dLgAMt3TbkmLkUqE]{Ready} an activity that takes 2 actions. If the activity has limited resources in some way, such as spell slots or a certain number of uses, you consume that resource whether your designated trigger occurs or not.

Play when you would be forcibly moved or knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} by an enemy.

You are not moved or knocked prone by the triggering effect. The enemy is instead pushed 10 feet away from you. You can Stride after them, but you must move the same distance and in the same direction.

Plan when you would roll a Fortitude or Reflex save

As long as you believe this cannot harm you, it simply can't. You roll a Will save instead against the triggering effect, and if it's a damaging effect, you can choose to take mental damage instead.

Play when you start your turn @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}

You stand up. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Special If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.gBSPbQRXdagZTUwY]{Kip Up}, you additionally Step or Interact to draw or pick up an item.

Play when you cast a spell with an area of effect and no duration.

You manipulate your spell's energy to avoid certain targets. Increase the number of actions required to Cast the Spell by one. You designate up to five creatures in the area to not be targeted by the spell. This is a spellshape effect.

Play at the start of your turn.

Before the end of your turn, you can Cast a Spell without spending a spell slot. The spell must be in your repertoire or be one you prepared today, and it can't be of your highest spell rank. After doing so, you trigger a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.N0pDFNCffTe2Du39]{Wellspring Surge} and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Play when you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by an enemy.

The enemy imposing the triggering condition becomes grabbed by you, even if you have no free hands. If they Escape your grab, you also lose the triggering condition.

Play when you are reduced to 0 Hit Points by an enemy.

In a last ditch effort, you make a Strike against the triggering enemy.

Play when an attack roll misses against a creature or when they succeed on a Reflex or Fortitude save.

You study the enemy's movements, gaining insight into its defensive tactics. You gain information as if you had succeeded at a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} check, however you can only gain information about the enemy's physical capabilities.

The scope of physical capabilities is at the GM's discretion, but learning about one of the triggering defenses would be an appropriate piece of information, as would be learning if they have a notable physical offensive ability, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.W7SbTykXrNwxDzJc]{Reactive Strike}.

Play during your turn.

You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition} an ally, automatically succeeding at this check instead of rolling, and you Step into their previous space.

Play at any time, as long as you have several items in your inventory.

You turn your backpack inside out in front of you, or otherwise scatter your mundane belongings on the floor. The area in a @Template[cone|distance:15] becomes difficult terrain.

Special At the GM's discretion, you may create this difficult terrain by using the environment in some way, such as knocking down a stack of crates, or dislodging stones from a cliff face.

Play during your turn, or when the trigger for an item's activation is met.

For this activation, reduce the number of actions required by 1. If the activation is a reaction, you can perform it as a free action instead.

Play during your turn.

You use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.wYerMk6F1RZb0Fwt]{Battle Medicine} even if you don't have the feat or a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.s1vB3HdXjMigYAnY]{Healer's Toolkit}. If you're untrained in Medicine, your proficiency bonus is equal to your level for this attempt, as you desperately draw from your previous adventuring experiences. You take a –1 circumstance penalty if you don't have a healer's toolkit.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.jZd0CVxpcW2OZLs0]{Effect: Perilous Patch-Up}

Special If you already have Battle Medicine, you can play this card even if the target would be immune to your Battle Medicine due to having already used it on them.

Play while you have your shield raised and an ally would take physical damage from an attack.

You Stride towards that ally. If you end that movement adjacent to them, you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} the triggering attack (even if you don't have the feat), except the shield reduces the damage your ally takes instead of yours.

Special You can play this card with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield} spell instead, in which case the triggering damage doesn't need to be physical. After using Shield Block in this way, you become immune to shield as normal.

Play when you fail or critically fail a check.

A vision of your downfall flashes before your eyes, allowing you to right your destiny at the last second. You gain a +1 status bonus to the triggering check retroactively, potentially changing its outcome.

Play at the start of your turn while wearing armor or wielding a shield.

You skillfully deflect and turn away from attacks, making the most out of your defensive tools. For 1 minute or until you are critically hit, your armor's item bonus to AC increases by 1, or the Hardness of your shield increases by 5.

Play when you critically succeed on saving throw forced by a creature, or a creature critically fails an attack roll against you.

You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature. For this attempt, you ignore the usual penalty due to the target not understanding you, and its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} value does not decrease until the end of its next turn. If you are untrained in Intimidation, you become trained for this attempt.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.ALm7s39VnA1O0IRj]{Effect: Revel in Arrogance}
